intro: Dolichos dinklagei, commonly known as the Dinklage's bean, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and trifoliate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that give way to elongated, bean-like pods. It is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and lesser-known species within the Dolichos genus.
